Vocabularies.Definition: v. admit or recognize sth. 承认
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   They refused to acknowledge that they were defeated.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. having knowledge or experience of sth. 知道的，明白的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He doesn't seem to be aware of the risk.
e.g.   The cat was beneath the chair.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. completely different 相反的 to the contrary 相反的（地）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   In spite of all the evidence to the contrary, Holmes was convinced the woman was innocent.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. explain what sth. is 定义，详细说明
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The teacher defined each confusing word for the students.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. upset 使苦恼，使不安，扰乱
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   If she's asleep, don't disturb her.
e.g.   They embraced each other tenderly on the station platform.
e.g.   With my parents away I've got the house all to myself.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. show that sth. is necessary, or that there is a good reason for sth. 证明…是正当的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He could not justify his absence from class this morning.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. allowed by law 合法的，法定的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The children's legal rights must be protected.
e.g.   Don't let go of the handle.
e.g.   The children are looking forward to the Spring Festival.
e.g.   Don't disturb him. He's in a very bad mood.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. an idea 观念，想法
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He had a sudden notion to leave.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. make smooth, bright and shiny by continual rubbing 擦亮
a. not often found or done 稀罕的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It's very rare for her to be late.
e.g.   She responded to my letter with a phone call.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. reason 缘故，理由 for one's sake out of consideration for; for the benefit of 为了…的缘故；为了…的利益
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He changed into old shoes for the sake of comfort.
